reviews.review_msg: As a history enthusiast, I loved this class!  Keeping up with readings and lectures is really important.  If you regularly participate, you'll get lots of feedback from the prof and she will provide help if you reach out.  I appreciated that she often allowed me to explore/focus on niche topics that I was interested in related to course content.

An outrageous sorry of an excuse for an incompetent instructor whose only redeemable qualities other than harshly berating students with a consistent barrage of unhelpful criticism and back-handed comments in a condescending and tactless manner. Fails to offer any modicum of constructive feedback while also having an uninspiring presentation style

She is the only professor who thinks the grammar matters in the paper. Also, somehow I think her lecture has bias on the certain area of history. Although she claimed that the lecture of the Second World War would be focusing on the entire world. She did not give a lot of information and lecture time to Asia and North Africa battles.
Well respected in her field. She is totally approachable and takes the time to help students who ask for it. One of the best History Dept profs at SFU!

lectures are really boring, slides were not engaging. Grading is heavy and she provided some backhanded comments on paper assignments when accidentally referred to something wrong. final was online and timed.

Ridiculous amount of weekly readings which you will not even be assessed on, since the course has limited opportunity for participation, and you are never actually assessed on the information in the readings (outside of primary sources, which are a fraction of the actual readings). Not remotely fair or just in terms of grading.

She gave very interesting lectures and answered any student questions. There were 3 small assignments, a midterm, final, and book review - all very fair, clear expectations given. Naz was an amazing TA, giving super helpful feedback on how to improve in the future. The weekly readings were long, but she was extremely kind - HIGHLY recommend her.
Critical feedback in written assignments, but is very helpful. She knows her stuff very well.
Fav prof in history dept.
Had Dr. Rossi for WW2 online and maybe the best put together online class I have taken at SFU.

Wow, I cannot believe how rude she is with her comments and feedback on assignments. I made one very slight and minor mistake, and she ripped into me on her comments, which was shocking. It seems like from the other comments on here, that people said her feedback is rude and very blunt. I am surprised with her rudeness on comments. Very strange.
Extremely difficult course and does not give good lectures. On top of that a very hard marker.

Honestly I don't know how she is a professor at SFU. Contradicts her own lecture content when mentioning her content in essays, etc., Sometimes her comments can be borderline rude towards students. Only take this course if you're passionate about the subject.

Gives you so much reading per week, you'd think it was for two courses. You may be able to skip parts of each week and kind of gamble on the readings to stay relevant during class discussions but lecture slides are a must to listen to at least.
Super nice, readings are interesting but heavy.
She is very picky about grammar, she is not helpful when it comes to explaining things when asking for help. Sometimes her grades, do not match with people's expectations.

I haven't met a professor who cares more about her students health or general well-being. She would do weekly check-ins with us before class started to make sure everything was ok. I've had her before in a previous class on a Monday morning and she would always start the class with a light-hearted video. Excellent leader, intelligent teacher. 10/10

Shes disorganized, doesnt have clear grading rubrics, takes forever to mark, and doesnt give good feedback. Her class was partially online so she had recorded powerpoints but the audio doesnt match the notes... For the in class tutorials, she doesnt talk about her lectures and expects us to know stuff that wasnt even taught for the quizzes.
Prof Rossi was very informative and professional. Her class was very information dense, and definitely not easy, but she made it possible. Not a GPA booster, but a great teacher if you want to learn

Lectures can be a little dry, but always focused and informative. Very knowledgeable on modern German history, especially in her stark, but sobering, insight into the mechanisms and consequences of the most infamous genocidal regime in history. Readings are well-selected and diverse in content. Highly recommended if pursuing a history major.

A great, knowledgeable professor who is clearly passionate about German history. There are a ton of course books which are unfortunately required (I had to buy around 5 books), and you MUST keep up on reading. Seminars were 3.5 hours of group discussion but it was very beneficial. Be prepared to read and talk often, but she is absolutely great.

No complaints about how Lauren dealt with the course material; all the readings were given their time and she clearly had a good grasp on how to navigate as difficult a subject as genocide through history. Group projects will always be a fine experience or a terrible one depending on your fellow classmates, so just be aware that it's gonna happen.

Amazing professor! Her lectures are clearly organized and easy to understand and follow. She cares deeply about her students and mental health, and even brought snacks for us for lectures. She is kind, very informative, and accessible for extra help. Highly recommend taking class with this professor.

I took her class on Genocide in a Historical Context and she was phenomenal. Her grading was fair, and she was so amazing. She would bring us snacks in order to make the stuff we were talking about a bit easier. She cares so much about her students mental health, especially on such a heavy topic. Will be taking her again!

Lauren is a great, knowledgable prof. The class is very heavy in its readings, which you need to do to participate in the tutorials. If you don't like reading, don't take this class. Grading is fair, but you definitely need to put a lot of effort in to get a good mark. That being said, I highly recommend this class and prof as you learn so much!

So. much. reading. So. many. assignments. I took this course online and the recorded lecture were monotone, stiffly read from a script and boring, despite the fact that the content is really interesting on its own. 3-4 weekly discussion posts required + assignments on a regularly basis. No exam BUT honestly way too much work for what it's worth
She is a great professor who is always available for extra help. I would highly recommend taking a class with her, however, you will have to work hard!
Great prof, incredibly knowledgeable, so make sure you know your stuff for tutorial
